El Duvelle
item.description: 3 #MastodonTips that I find useful:1.When you follow a new account, activate the notifications (üîî) icon next to the follow button. That way their posts won't get lost in the Big Timeline and you can get an idea of whether you want to keep following them on the long term. 2.If someone boosts too much for you, but you still want to see their original posts in your timeline, you can deactivate their boosts (in the options for their profile: ...> Hide boosts). (Unfortunately this doesn't hide boosts in their profile, which would be great to have as an option)3.If your posts don't get boosted as much as you'd like, it could be that they don't have AltText! You can set a reminder for adding it in the "Compose box" options (the two ‚öôÔ∏è ): tick "Show confirmation dialog before sending toots lacking media descriptions"Enjoy and let me know if you have any questions!#Mastodon #MastodonTip

item.title: Dan Gillmor
item.description: Australia's under-16 ban on social media isn't just absurd. It's dangerous in almost every way. It denies a parental role in child-raising.It's a gift to the media barons, especially the Murdochs, who control legacy media and will profit hugely.And it is huge step toward government control of speech of all kinds, because age requirements require age verification. Age verification blows away all privacy. it amounts to a license to read and speak. And licenses can be taken away.
